title: Rocky Mountain National Park: Management Plans
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Management Plans              Management Plans        Elk graze in Moraine Park NPS        Master Plan Foundation Document Overview Complete Document  Annual Water Quality Reports Bark Beetle Management Plan Commercial Horse Use Plan Elk and Vegetation Management Plan Fire Management Plan Guided Climbing Strategy  Invasive Exotic Plant Management Plan Land Protection Plan Trail Plan Vegetation Restoration Plan Wilderness/Backcountry Management Plan  Some plans are not currently available in digital format. To request a copy of a specific management plan, please contact the Information Office at 970-586-1206 or e-mail us.      Learn More Management Plans provide guidance to park managers. They often include an Environmental Assessment (EA) that evaluates alternative strategies. Some require an Environmental Impact Statement (EIS) because of potentially significant impacts or controversial topics. Management Plans are made available for public review and comment during the proposal and implementation stages.
